TopicDetails.title: Conferences, workshops and seminars
TopicDetails.callTitle: Union Anti-Fraud Programme Training, Conferences, Staff Exchanges and Studies
TopicDetails.description:
Scope:

Organising conferences, workshops and seminars and creating networks and structural platforms between Member States, candidate countries, other third countries, EU institutions and international organisations:

a) to facilitate the exchange of information, experience and best practices, including in the field of data analysis;

b) to create networks and improve coordination between Member States, candidate countries, other third countries, EU institutions and international organisations;

c) to facilitate multi-disciplinary cooperation between anti-fraud practitioners and academics and raise awareness among the judiciary and other legal professionals in relation to the protection of the Union’s financial interests.

Expected Impact:

Increased abilities of professionals involved in the protection of the Union’s financial interests through the acquisition of new skills, knowledge of specialised methodologies and techniques as well as an increased awareness of fraud risk indicators and the Union’s anti-fraud policy priorities. Increased network and exchange of best practices opportunities. These results will be measured, amongst others, by the number of events and number of participants, their origin and professional background and the level of participants’ overall satisfaction with the events.

callDetailsJSONItem.staticAdditionalInfo:
Union Anti-Fraud Programme (UAFP) funded actions aim to protect the financial interests of the European Union by preventing and combating fraud, corruption and any other illegal activities affecting the financial interests of the Union.

The Commission encourages transnational and multidisciplinary cooperation, exchanges of knowledge and best practices, and the creation of networks between national authorities as well as between practitioners and academics involved in the field of the protection of the financial interests of the Union. The Commission also aims at further raising the awareness of the judiciary and other branches of the legal profession for the protection of the Union’s financial interests.

The UAFP sets a specific objective to prevent and combat fraud, corruption and any other illegal activities affecting the financial interests of the Union.

Eligible actions implement the specific objective of the UAFP. The following actions are eligible for funding:

1. enhancing staff exchanges for specific projects, ensuring the necessary support and facilitating investigations, in particular the setting up of joint investigation teams and cross-border operations;

2. providing technical and operational support to national investigations, in particular to customs and law enforcement authorities to strengthen the fight against fraud and other illegal activities;

3. organising specialised training, risk analysis workshops, conferences and studies aimed towards improving cooperation and coordination among services concerned with the protection of the financial interests of the Union.

The Commission invites the applicants to explore certain indicative priority areas elaborated in the Call text published.

These actions may include support to the Associations for European Criminal Law and for the Protection of EU Financial Interests.

Maximum project duration: between 12 and 24 months

The indicative available budget for grants for this Call is EUR 1 600 000.

The grants will cover a maximum of 80% (90% in exceptional and duly justified cases ) of the eligible costs of the action.

The indicative threshold for the TOTAL budgeted costs of a project submitted is set at EUR 40 000. However, such an indicative threshold does not apply to staff exchanges.
